<@U0K77TNPP|ikikn> has joined the channel
Hi guys, is this the right place to ask a question about an Android animation I have to make ? I really need help, I'm desperate !

I have to create this animation, and I don't really know how I can do that:

<https://www.dropbox.com/s/yi9nk7b4jg4v813/2a_08.mp4?dl=0>

The problem is that I don't really know how I can "stick" the bar with the buttons to the toolbar after the title disappears behind it.

I was able, with a CollapsingToolbarLayout to create the Toolbar that can be expanded and collapsed but I have troubles to make the white bar below the Toolbar.

I would like to have some help. I'm really lost.

Thanks.
<@U0K77TNPP>: have you tried to add the buttons in the toolbar of the collapsible toolbar

<https://sites.google.com/a/android.com/tools/recent/androidstudio20preview7available|Android Studio 2.0 Preview 7 Available>
We've just pushed Android Studio 2.0 Preview 7 to the canary channel. This contains a number of bug fixes on top of preview 6, particularly in the Instant Run area (there is also a 2.0.0-alpha7 version of the Gradle plugin). oh man, does anyone have a clear solution for a simple flow between two edit texts
tap input 1 -> show keyboard … edit stuff -> hit next on keyboard -> focus on the second input -> show keyboard … edit stuff -> hit done on keyboard -> hide keyboard
should be simple, but the second input does not lose focus after hitting done on the keyboard

the last snippet did not have one

or dont set the title
<@U0K65E0NB>: you will have to remove the focus
<@U0JLWN2RH>: I figured, but that sends the focus back to the first input
which is also not what I want
do you have a submit button or something that can take the focus?
hm nope, theres the two text inputs and three radio buttons
put in an empty view to take the focus
i think i do that in one of my apps to prevent the keyboard from opening when the fragment starts
I saw that while googling, will that still close the keyboard then after hittin „done“?
and I will still need to call `lastInput.clearFocus()`?
hmm, you can set a `View.OnFocusChangeListener` to code in whatever logic you want
there's no keyboard API for some reason but there's ways to close it
not sure, just try it without anything fancy and see what happens first? :stuck_out_tongue:
aw man, keyboard stays open
you can close the keyboard if that is what you are trying to do
most users though will close the keyboard too i have found on there own
I’d just wish I could lose the focus without focusing something else
like <@U0546QERR> said you can have a listener and check for the done key to be entered and then close the keyboard
that is how i have tied it directly to the user pressing the done button
is there an official way to close the keyboard
half the answers on stackoverflow never work
that one does work, but will it on all the devices? haha
hello everyone! has anyone here used a flux-like pattern of data flow in their app?
<@U0K65E0NB>: one sec
<@U0JLWN2RH|srayhunter> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/srayhunter/F0K7WL2K1/hide_keyboard.java|hide keyboard>

file.name: hide_keyboard.java
file.title: hide keyboard
file.preview_highlight:
public static void hideKeyboard(Activity activity) {
	View view = activity.getCurrentFocus();
	if(view != null) {
		InputMethodManager inputManager = (InputMethodManager)activity.getSystemService("input_method");
		inputManager.hideSoftInputFromWindow(view.getWindowToken(), 0);

text: that has worked for me
the input_method string you could probably change
i think that is just some legacy code i need to update
`Context.INPUT_METHOD_SERVICE` seems to be a replacement for that?
okay thanks

yep
i have not used it

i personally dont do much outside of native

Good luck, you'll need it.
